document_data.caption: A map showing Urling on the southern edge of the Urlingwood.
document_data.name: Urling
document_data.mainbody: '''Urling''' was a small, hidden-away settlement located in the [[Urlingwood]] forest of [[Rashemen]]. It was home to many witches of the nation's [[Wychlaran]].
document_data.Description: At first glance Urling appeared to be nothing more than a primordial grove of [[evergreen]] and [[alder]] trees. In between the trees were rolling grassy mounds, within which were the traditional stone lodges that were associated with Rashemen.

Geography.Flora & Fauna: The various herbs and fruits needed to make ''[[jhuild]]'', also known as Rashemi firewine, could be found and harvested in the area around Urling.

document_data.Government: [[Yhelbruna|Lady Yhelbruna]] led the community of of Urling ''circa'' the early 1470s [[DR]], assisted by [[Nythra]] of the [[Seven Rivers]]. Nythra served as a go-between for the hathrans and the other Rashemi of the community, and spoke to any of its outlander visitors.
document_data.Trade: For many years, travelers were allowed to stay overnight in Urling, and in those instances only for a day or two. Various sources differed as to whether or not intruders were actually punished by execution or if that was merely exaggeration.
document_data.Notable Locations: * [[The Green Chapel]], the hamlet's lone inn and only building open to outlanders.
document_data.Inhabitants: While Urling was the home to many [[hathran]]s of Rashemen it was not exclusive to their order as was the Urlingwood. Rashemaar commoners native to the country were allowed residence within, including the witches' spouses, family members, and servants.
